qas.question: To what annual art festival is the city of New Haven home?

answers.text: International Festival of Arts and Ideas

qas.question: What was the inaugural year of the New Haven St. Patrick's Day parade?
In what historic New Haven neighborhood does the St. Andrew the Apostle Italian festival take place?
What annual festival, celebrated on New Haven Green, memorializes the New Haven's passage into the Revolutionary War?
In what year did Film Fest New Haven begin?
What international event celebrating art is hosted in New Haven?

answers.text: International Festival of Arts and Ideas

qas.question: As one of the oldest and largest traditions, how long have the city been celebrating Saint Patrick's Day?
Which event takes place every year in Wooster Square since the beginning of the 20th century?

answers.text: St. Andrew the Apostle Italian Festival

qas.question: What organization was responsible for the planting of several cherry blossom trees in 1973?
In general how many people attend  the yearly Wooster Square Cheery Blossom Festival?

context: In addition to the Jazz Festival (described above), New Haven serves as the home city of the annual <a0_0><a5_0>International Festival of Arts and Ideas<a5_0/><a0_0/>. New Haven's Saint Patrick's Day parade, which began in <a1_0><a6_0>1842<a6_0/><a1_0/>, is New England's oldest St. Patty's Day parade and draws the largest crowds of any one-day spectator event in Connecticut. The <a7_0>St. Andrew the Apostle Italian Festival<a7_0/> has taken place in the historic <a2_0>Wooster Square<a2_0/> neighborhood every year since 1900. Other parishes in the city celebrate the Feast of Saint Anthony of Padua and a carnival in honor of St. Bernadette Soubirous. New Haven celebrates <a3_0>Powder House Day<a3_0/> every April on the New Haven Green to commemorate the city's entrance into the Revolutionary War. The annual Wooster Square Cherry Blossom Festival commemorates the 1973 planting of 72 Yoshino Japanese Cherry Blossom trees by the <a8_0>New Haven Historic Commission<a8_0/> in collaboration with the New Haven Parks Department and residents of the neighborhood. The Festival now draws well <a9_0>over 5,000 visitors<a9_0/>. The Film Fest New Haven has been held annually since <a4_0>1995<a4_0/>.
